description.narrative: the project will seek to strengthen the resilience of the forty-two Palestinian gatherings host communities through enhancing living conditions.

participating-org.narrative: SDC-Swiss Agency For Development and Co
US Department of State, Office to monitor & combat Tracking in persons.

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.1. # Of individuals with sufficient safe water supply at an adequate level of service. 1.2. # Of individuals with access to wastewater/sewage systems. 1.3. # Of individuals with access to reliable solid waste services. 1.4. # Of local mechanisms with systems and capacities strengthened for improved service delivery. 2.1. # Of refugees living in structurally safe shelters. 2.2. # Of refugees living in environmentally adequate shelters. 2.3. # Of refugees with access to water and energy conservation solutions. 3.1. # Of neighbourhood upgrading plans developed in the gatherings. 3.2. # Of neighbourhoods with safer roads including electricity networks and street lighting, storm water disposal, paving and). 3.3. # Of neighbourhoods with inclusive and positive community spaces. 4.1. # Of individuals disaggregated by sex and age who have experienced behaviour change session/activities. 4.2. # Of individuals disaggregated by sex who have received training on promoting positive hygiene practices in their communities. 4.3. # Of individuals with access to hygiene or baby kits. 5.1. # Of self-sustained livelihood community projects. 5.2. # Of individuals disaggregated by sex who have received vocational training. 5.3. # Of small business owners disaggregated by sex, who have received start-up grants. 6.1. # Of meeting of the Gatherings working Group 6.2. Database on living conditions, needs and interventions in Palestinian gatherings developed and shared with active organizations. 6.3. # of studies / reports issued. 6.4 # Of individuals (and youth) who benefited from NGOs activities 6.5 # Of communities benefitting from support to local economic infrastructure

comment.narrative:
3.1.1 Development of Response Plan workshop for each union: Northern Akkar and Baalbek 3.1.2 Development of related capacity building for 2 unions 3.1.3 Provision of equipment and tools for each union (furniture and laptops): 2018 Union of Northern Akkar 3.1.4 Implementation of pilot mitigation projects
3.2.1 Development and dissemination of DRR awareness material at the local level in at least 10 communities in Akkar, 8 communities in Baalbek and 12 communities in South. 3.2.2 Procurement of services for a communication consultant technical support 3.2.2 Implementation of IDRR Day
